meanings.definition: The internal organs of a human or animal, especially when removed or exposed.
meanings.sent1: The hunter examined the entrails of the deer to determine its age.
meanings.sent2: The butcher carefully removed the entrails from the pig.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that the secret to a delicious stew was in the entrails of the recipe.
meanings.sent4: As the detective sifted through the entrails of evidence, he pieced together the crime.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the entrails made the young student queasy during biology class.

meanings.definition: The innermost parts or essential elements of something.
meanings.sent1: The entrails of the mystery novel revealed the true culprit.
meanings.sent2: In the entrails of the ancient text, the historian found a hidden message.
meanings.sent3: The treasure hunter believed the map held the key to the entrails of the lost city.
meanings.sent4: Within the entrails of the problem lay the solution waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The artist poured his emotions into the entrails of his latest masterpiece.
